title.narrative: 004 Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) AND EMERGENCIES

description.narrative: Enhance capacity of Government and communities to prepare and respond to, and recover from Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) related emergencies in accordance with the CCCs, which contributes to Sanitation, Wash And Emergencies. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Ethiopian population living in healthy environments, using safe drinking water and adequate sanitation services , and practicing hygiene increased

participating-org.narrative: AFAR REGIONAL DISASTER PREVENTION F SECURITY AND PROGRAMME COORDINATION OFFICE

mailing-address.narrative: UNICEF House (Kazanchis - Opposite UNECA/German House) P.O. Box 1169 Addis Ababa

sector.narrative: Public health emergencies, including disease outbreaks

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Enhance capacity of Government and communities to prepare and respond to, and recover from WASH related emergencies in accordancewith the CCCs

description.narrative: As part of the WASH emergency response, access to safe water supply was provided to 1,270,931 people and a total of 354,936 people were provided with safe latrine and 396,898 people participated in various hygiene promotion activities. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:30/06/2016

title.narrative: Indicator1: No . of people affected by emergencies (including vulnerable host population) provided with safe access to sufficient water, of appropriate quality for drinking cooking and personal hygiene

target.value: 2016:60% of population targeted (1.3 million - as per HRD projections)

actual.value: 2016:1,149,239 emergency affected people are provided with safe access to sufficient water.

title.narrative: Indicator 2:No of emergency affected population (including vulnerable host population) provided with safe access to appropriately designed toilets and living in environments free of open defecation

target.value: 2016:60% of population targeted (1.3 million - as per HRD projections)

actual.value: 2016:354,936 emergency affected people are provided with access to safe latrine.

title.narrative: Indicator 3: N0. of people affected by emergencies (including vulnerable host population) participating in hygiene promotion activities

target.value: 2016:50% of population targeted (1.3 million - as per HRD projections)

actual.value: 2016:396,898 emergency affected people participated in various hygiene promotion activities.
